Package com.google.calendar.interoperability.connectorplugin.base

Interface Summary
GwIo This interface abstracts IO-based operations necessary in the GroupWise API directory structure.
LdapUserFilter.Connector This interface represents the connection logic for LDAP (replaced by mocks in unit tests).
PasswordLoader.EncryptionStrategy Strategy to be used for encryption/decryption of passwords.
SelfTestable Classes implementing this interface can run a short self-test to see if they are set up correctly.
Sink<T> Accepts incoming objects and enqueues them for a SEDA stage to process.
 

Class Summary
BasicSearchHandler Convenience-class for implementing free/busy search handlers.
CommandHandler Extensible base command for handling GwCommands
Configurable Helper-class.
GarbageCollector Function that cleans up objects from the in-folder that belong to previously handled messages
GwFileIo This implementation if the GwIo interfaces uses a directory on the local file system.
HackedSSLSocketFactory This class is a modified version of the standard SSL socket factory that trusts any incoming certificate.
InputScanner Scans an inbound folder for incoming API messages and enqueues them into a sink.
LdapUserFilter This class contains knowledge about rules when to filter out a user and not pass him along in a DirSync operation.
NullSink<S> A class that can be used as an endpoint of a SEDA queue (simply discards anything added).
Parser Parser for commands
PasswordLoader A class that can be used to encrypt clear-text passwords in configuration files.
PrintFunction<S,T> Simple function for basic tests: prints any incoming object out to System.out and returns null
Responder This class takes a response object and writes it back into the outgoing folder for Exchange
ShellUtility Logic to execute a task in the operating system
SimpleSink<S> Base class for simple sink implementations: assumes that elements should be processed in the order in which they arrive.
SimpleStage<S,T> A simple stage implementation that uses a bunch of parallel daemon threads and assumes they never crash
Stage<S,T> A stage in a SEDA architecture.
Tuple<T> A pair of two elements of the same kind.
 

Enum Summary
Configurable.Type Supported types that can be parsed
GwIo.FOLDER This enumeration represents the folders accessible to I/O operations
